arm_group.description: Students allocated to the active comparator arm will follow 5 sessions in Class-led instruction of reading patients' diaries or nurses'diaries. They will be divided into eight subgroups of 12 students. The first and fifth sessions will be presential, and 2nd 3rd and 4th sessions will be homework to do on internet.

Students allocated to the active comparator arm will follow 5 sessions in Class-led instruction of reading literature. They will be divided into eight subgroups of 12 students. The first and fifth sessions will be presential, and 2nd 3rd and 4th sessions will be homework to do on internet.

brief_summary.textblock:
Objective: The aim of this study is to assess the impact of an educational program of
      Narrative Medicine "workshop reading diaries" dedicated to medical students on their
      empathy.

      Design: Randomized Controlled Trial in 2 arms. Participants: Medical students (4th years) of
      the University Paris Descartes. Methods: participants will be randomized in 2 groups. The
      allocation of participants will be done by a computerized randomization list, the sequence
      will be created by an independent statistician. Participants will be blinded of the study
      hypothesis. Allocation concealment will be provided because only the statistician will have
      access to the randomization list.

      A  program of Narrative Medicine with lesson in small group of "workshop reading patients'
      diaries " vs  "workshop reading literature".

      Outcome: The primary endpoint will be a first measure of the empathy of the medical
      students. The secondary endpoints will be a second measure of the empathy of the medical
      student; satisfaction of the student relative to the educational program .

      Potential interests: We believe that the workshop "reading patients' diaries" can develop
      the thinking of the student with respect to his behavior with the patient, and so the
      relation between student and patient.

      Sample size expected: 200 participants.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Narrative Medicine (Workshop Reading Diaries)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All students in the fourth year of medical

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  refuse to participate

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of an Educational Program 'Narrative Medicine (Workshop Reading Diaries) ' Dedicated to Medical Students. A Randomized Controlled Trial.

primary_outcome.description: self-administered questionnaire consisting of 20 items scored by a Likert-type scale (strongly agree = 7, strongly disagree = 1): 10 items are rated positively, others 10 items are rated negatively. The total score ranges from 20 to 140.
primary_outcome.measure: The Jefferson Scale of Physician Empathy
primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 months after randomization (i.e. 1 month after the end of the intervention)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: self-administered questionnaire with 4 subscales (Perspective Taking, Empathic Concern, Fantasy, Personal Distress) each containing seven items (a total of 28 items). The items are scored by a Likert scale (0 = Does not describe me well to 4 = Describes me very well).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 5 months after randomization (i.e. 1 month after the end of the intervention)

secondary_outcome.description: measure on a numeric scale from 0 (without interest) to 10 (very interesting)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 months after randomization (i.e. 1 month after the end of the intervention)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
